page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content: NJ526314{SLATE BRIG}(BRIDGE). This is an old unused bridge over the River Bogie, built with slates from the old quarries in Gartly. NJ526314{PILL BOX}One of the very few relics of the Second World war. It is situated at a bend on the B9002 road by a bridge over the River Bogie and the main Aberdeen-Inverness railway. NJ522324{GARTLY STATION.}This used to be the name of the village as written on the maps,as a station was officially opened on 19th Sept 1854 as a stop on The Great North of Scotland Railway Line (GNSR). Regular services continued (later as part of the LNER) until the 1960's when the station, though not the line, was closed. For several years the name was removed totally from the maps until letters from the pupils explained that an expanding village still existed.
